meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or distance.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah easily outfooted the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: She always outfoots her friends when they go for a run.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident in his outfooting abilities.
meanings.sent4: The Olympic sprinter outfooted all her competitors to win the gold medal.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship outfooted all previous records for speed in space travel.

meanings.definition: The act of outpacing or outperforming someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His outfooting of the competition earned him the first-place trophy.
meanings.sent2: The company's outfooting of its rivals secured its position as the industry leader.
meanings.sent3: The student's outfooting of his classmates in the exam surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her outfooting of the previous record holder was celebrated by fans.
meanings.sent5: The team's outfooting of expectations led to a surprising victory.

meanings.definition: The state of being ahead or in front of others.
meanings.sent1: The runner's outfooting in the marathon was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The car's outfooting on the track made it a favorite to win the race.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit's outfooting of the other animals in the forest was legendary.
meanings.sent4: The leader's outfooting in the polls gave him a strong advantage.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's outfooting in the savanna was a sight to behold.
